result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas Francis Peterson Sr.

records.addlTxt: of 10-20-22 Preliminary hearing held before the Honorable Edward Vlack, filed by DAR Gina Gross. mw

10:17 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Adam P Nero in court for Douglas Francis Peterson Sr. Defendant Douglas Francis Peterson Sr. in court. Court reviews case. S/T Officer Radke. Direct by Atty Damrau. Record to reflect the identity of DE for todays purposes only. PL O/R Exhibit 1 for stipulation for today only. Cross by Atty Nero. Witness excused. Attorney arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court sets ARGN. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 10:59 AM
Arraignment scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
for refusal hearing. Filed by Atty Nero. arc   to rg
22SW284 executed on 8/19/2022. Search Warrant, Application and Affidavit signed by EFV on 8/19/2022. Filed in 22CF575. olg

The original document was titled: Report
The original history event date is: 08-22-2022
Pretrial Assessment Report, reviewed during INIT. bph

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least FOUR times per day between 6:00 a.m. and 10:00 p.m. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:21 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Douglas Francis Peterson Sr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam P Nero in court for Douglas Francis Peterson Sr. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Bond argument; bond ordered. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets Preliminary Hearing. Adjourned at 1:30 PM.  gll
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
